meanings.definition: To place or store in a bin.
meanings.sent1: She binned the toys neatly in the storage bin.
meanings.sent2: He binned the groceries in the pantry after shopping.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel binned all the nuts in one place for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The librarian binned the books on the shelves like precious treasures.
meanings.sent5: The chef binned the spices in labeled containers for easy access.

meanings.sent1: They binned the broken vase to make space for a new one.
meanings.sent2: After the party, she binned the leftover food that couldn't be saved.
meanings.sent3: The magician binned the torn card to make it disappear for real.
meanings.sent4: He binned his old habits to embrace a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The gardener binned the withered plants to make room for fresh blooms.
